frameDefinitions: In this frame an Agriculturist cultivates Food.
A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.
A Whole, an entity with a substructure, is assessed for whether or not it has all the necessary parts that are defined for it or for an entity of its kind.
This frame involves a Creator making a duplicate, the Copy, of some Original entity.
This frame is concerned with nouns denoting a part or parts of a Whole entity .
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
frameExamples: Peasants were encouraged to <t>cultivate</t> basic food crops such as beans and corn
The claimant should then submit medical certificates for the duration of their <t>absence</t> from work.INI
What happens after the PPB investigation is <t>complete</t>?
The teacher <t>copied</t> the problem onto the blackboard.
Kim forgot a large <t><fex name='Part'>part</fex></t> of the story.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agriculturist</fen> is the agent cultivating <fen>Food</fen>.
<fex name='Food'>Food</fex> is the item cultivated by the <fen>Agriculturist</fen>.
This is the the background or context for the <fen>Food</fen> to which the <fen>Agriculturist</fen> pays attention in his agricultural efforts.
When the agricultural event occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Agriculturist</fen> cultivates <fen>Food</fen>.
The person who is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen> of time.
This role describes the activity or responsiblilities from which the <fen>Person</fen> is taking a temporary leave.
The amount of time the <fen>Person</fen> is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen>.  This can also be expressed as a description of a duration, as shown below:
The time at which the leave occurs.
The entity that is being assessed for having all its necessary parts or not.
The interval of time when the completeness of the entity is assessed.
The <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Copy</fen> based on the <fen>Original</fen>.  It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
The <fen>Original</fen> is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object:
The <fen>Copy</fen> produced by the <fen>Creator</fen> is frequently not expressed. However, when <fen>Copy</fen> does occur, it is usually expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes <fen>Place</fen>.
A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.
An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
listRoleExamples: Romans were cultivating <fex>the land</fex> in Northern Gaul.
During his <fex>wife's</fex> absence, Linkworth and his mother had another violent argument.
Such conditions would be likely to lead to absence <fex>from work</fex>.
Dissuaded from resigning, Macmillan took <fex>extended</fex> leave rather than restrain his public utterances.
Columbus took leave of the known world <fex>on 6 September 1492</fex>.
<fex>Our list of participants</fex> is still incomplete.
My journey to the dark side is <fex>now</fex> complete.
<fex>The results</fex> replicate those of an earlier study.
Sergey had  <fex>half</fex> of the pizza for breakfast.
Sergey had  half <fex>of the pizza</fex> for breakfast.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: a Book of the Year by Suspense
Cut to the Bone a Top Pick
